channel.title: Lunix | Custom gameplay
channel.description:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/lzGdAkr.png[/img]
[size=14pt][b]About:[/b][/size] Elysia is a framework I developed with netty 5 networking. I recently started continuing the development under the name Lunix, with the goal to create a playable game with it.
[size=14pt][b]Custom gameplay?[/b][/size] I don't plant on making another remake. I want to make something unique even if it's not appreciated. All skills as well as combat are going to be looked at how it can be "different". First I want to keep it simple with working with what the basic client has to offer and change actual play content. Later on I might start modifying a client to my likings.
[size=14pt][b]Current features:[/b][/size]
[ul][li]Dialogues system[/li] [li]Npc interaction system[/li] [li]Npc movement and clipped following[/li] [li]Clipped player movement[/li] [li]Custom/temporary objects also get clipped[/li] [li]banking, inventory, equipment, equipping, dropping etc...[/li] [li]npc/player dying[/li] [li]shopping[/li] [li]punishment system[/li] [li]task system[/li] [li]data loading with gson[/li] [li]player commands[/li] [li]Skilling system[/li][/ul]
[b]Object and ground item updating[/b] - Custom objects and ground items fill a list of local players when they are spawned. - When the state changes the players of their local list update the new object. - When a player enters a region he will be added to the list of local players from the nearby objects/grounditems.
[size=14pt][b]Media:[/b][/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/4B3QWck.png[/img] This is a stress test. There is really nothing of lag at this point. Though the players are very spread and not interacting.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/8UAict3.png[/img]
[i]I wont update this very much, just once in a while when I think about it.[/i]

item.title: Lunix | Custom gameplay
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Lothy:

Haven’t you already posted this several times in the past?

I have posted this once when I finished it as a login server.
There was no content or plans on adding content back then.

Update:
A skilling system has been added and together with that burying bones.

Read full topic

item.title: Lunix | Custom gameplay
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[size=14pt]About:[/size]
Elysia is a framework I developed with netty 5 networking.
I recently started continuing the development under the name Lunix, with the goal to create a playable game with it.

[size=14pt]Custom gameplay?[/size]
I don’t plant on making another remake. I want to make something unique even if it’s not appreciated.
All skills as well as combat are going to be looked at how it can be “different”.
First I want to keep it simple with working with what the basic client has to offer and change actual
play content. Later on I might start modifying a client to my likings.

[size=14pt]Current features:[/size]

[ul][li]Dialogues system[/li]
[li]Npc interaction system[/li]
[li]Npc movement and clipped following[/li]
[li]Clipped player movement[/li]
[li]Custom/temporary objects also get clipped[/li]
[li]banking, inventory, equipment, equipping, dropping etc…[/li]
[li]npc/player dying[/li]
[li]shopping[/li]
[li]punishment system[/li]
[li]task system[/li]
[li]data loading with gson[/li]
[li]player commands[/li]
[li]Skilling system[/li][/ul]

Object and ground item updating

  • Custom objects and ground items fill a list of local players when they are spawned.
  • When the state changes the players of their local list update the new object.
  • When a player enters a region he will be added to the list of local players from the nearby objects/grounditems.

[size=14pt]Media:[/size]

This is a stress test. There is really nothing of lag at this point.
Though the players are very spread and not interacting.

I wont update this very much, just once in a while when I think about it.

Read full topic
